alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 9:28AM CST until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche LaFave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...From late Thursday night until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 22.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Friday morning and continue rising to a crest of 28.6 feet Saturday evening. This crest is based off future rainfall expected over the next 48 hours. Continue to monitor latest forecasts for any updates. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 22.6 Wed 8 AM 23.1 26.1 28.4 28.6 6 PM 3/04 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 48 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
